meanings.definition: Of or relating to the cutting edges of the incisor teeth.
meanings.sent1: The dentist examined the incisal edges of the teeth for any signs of wear.
meanings.sent2: She pointed out the incisal part of the tooth that needed filling.
meanings.sent3: The incisal teeth were so sharp they could slice through anything!
meanings.sent4: Her incisal critique of the dental hygiene was cutting but accurate.
meanings.sent5: The incisal nature of the teeth made them perfect for tearing food apart.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or situated near the cutting edge of a tooth.
meanings.sent1: The incisal area of the tooth was sensitive to cold drinks.
meanings.sent2: He carefully cleaned the incisal surface of the tooth to remove any plaque.
meanings.sent3: The incisal part of the tooth seemed to be the most adventurous.
meanings.sent4: Her incisal attention to detail in dental care was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The incisal position of the cavity made it difficult to reach with the brush.

meanings.definition: The cutting edge of a tooth.
meanings.sent1: The incisal of the tooth was chipped and needed repair.
meanings.sent2: She felt pain whenever food touched the incisal of her tooth.
meanings.sent3: The incisal of the tooth was like a tiny sword ready to cut through food.
meanings.sent4: His smile revealed the incisal of his teeth, sharp and gleaming.
meanings.sent5: The incisal of the tooth was so sharp, it could easily slice paper.
